page.title: 07GOONHILLY NATURE RESERVE
page.content: In the past burning of the heath was common practice to help the vegetation regenerate to aid summer grazing. Little grazing is now permitted - where it does take place fires still occur and are usually started accidentally by cigarette ends or matches. Over the last two centuries many hectares of Goonhilly have been 'reclaimed' for farming. This is a long process taking several years ploughing, manuring and harrowing. Fortunately what remains has beem claimed by the NCC and only grazing is allowed.There have been recent cases of farmers on the fringe of the Downs reclaiming a few hectares 'quietly' - the problem is once the law has been broken the natural environment is lost forever.
